http://uneasysilence.com/archive/2006/08/7331/

TELESYNC (TS): A telesync is the same spec as a CAM except it uses an external audio source (most likely an audio jack in the chair for hard of hearing people). A direct audio source does not ensure a good quality audio source, as a lot of background noise can interfere. A lot of the times a telesync is filmed in an empty cinema or from the projection booth with a professional camera, giving a better picture quality. Quality ranges drastically, check the sample before downloading the full release. A high percentage of Telesyncs are CAMs that have been mislabeled.

apparently some people are confused about the difference between a TS and a Cam


TS:  Direct input from the projector with better sound.  Typically uses a video output from the projector

CAM:  exactly what it sounds like...somebody used a Camcorder to record the movie.


TS will usually result in quality that is on par with TV broadcast over the airways...or a old VHS tape converted to Digital

Cam is usually like softcore homemade porn with shitty quality and barely watchable.

so that being said...is this a TS or a CAM

Review: Bruce Willis is great.  His wife is good.  The story makes sense.  The only problem I have is with the execution.  I think this movie would have needed a few more million dollars to do it right really because if this takes place 20 years in the future or in any kind of future where this stuff is possible then there would likely be a lot more difference in the way we live than JUST these robots.  For instance why even use cars?  Just run there with your super speed.  Why even live in reality?  If you can feel what your robot does then you wouldn't even need to be in reality at all.  How do people procreate?  Sports would probably be really cool.  I think they just switched out people for robots and barely changed anything else.  It got the message across, but if something like this ever approached reality there would be so many other changes to our daily lives this would hardly be the biggest.  Also to be a little nit-picky everything about these surrogates is nearly possible except a brain interface that you can FEEL through.  That isn't even a zygote in a laboratory anywhere so most people wouldn't want to pretend to be robots without getting any physical pleasure out of it.

Audio: 4 (barely understandable)
Video: 5 (washed out: however the actual movie probably looks awesome in the theater or for real)

Thanks for the great upload!!

-Nick
